•Implemented, educated and reinforced scrum methodology and agile framework within three new scrum teams (local and distributed)•Facilitated scrum ceremonies including release planning, backlog grooming, sprint planning, sprint reviews/demos, retrospectives, and daily scrums•Protected development team from outside distractions, removed impediments, and worked to resolve team conflicts in order to keep the team focused on sprint commitments and project timelines•Enabled the teams to establish velocity for improved estimation and commitment during planning•Tracked product backlog items, sprint/release burndown metrics, velocity, and task breakdown •Aligned with product team in prioritization of product backlog items to allow the team to have a clear focus delivering committed features on time and iteratively, delivering value to the business biweekly•Partnered with delivery managers to identify cross-team dependencies, manage inter-team tasks, and coordinate deployments•Improved morale and established clear goals by effectively managing timelines and shared resources with special emphasis on building relationships across departments•Addressed project issues through risk management and contingency planning•Guided projects to completion on time and on budget ensuring delivery was compliant to scope commitment

•Managed and delivered multiple projects to agreed upon scope, budget, schedule and expectations while monitoring scope creep and risks•Worked closely with cross-functional decision makers, executives and stakeholders to identify, recommend, develop, implement, and support business applications solutions for all facets of the organization•Analyzed and documented business requirements pertaining to usability and improvement of business applications and business process automation•Provided administration, customization, support, and maintenance for a wide range of company software applications and cloud based solutions•Developed workflow automation, detailed data reporting and visualization solutions using Salesforce Reports & Dashboards, Crystal Reports, TaskCentre, and SQL•Managed IT budget, expenses, vendors and resources (local & offshore)-Project highlights:•Salesforce.com: Managed project to develop a heavily customized Salesforce.com Enterprise implementation including a full data migration from InforCRM within a 4 mo time-frame with significant development cost savings. Minimized scope of project to ensure a proper phased approach leading to high user adoption rate and a successful, timely launch.•SpringCM Contract Management: Managed project to implement a contract management tool to provide efficiencies for legal and sales depts. SpringCM was fully integrated with Salesforce to enable sales mgrs to efficiently auto-generate sales order documents based off of opportunity data with minimal need for legal counsel involvement. Avg time to signature was decreased by more than 50%•Exchange 2007 upgrade to Office365: Managed project to migrate Exchange 2007 to Office 365 for entire organization. Project was completed ahead of schedule with minimal downtime•Clarizen project management: Implemented a project management tool to meet the specific requirements of 6 different depts, enabling cross-departmental collaboration and efficiency on org wide projects
Business Analyst / Project Manager, Professional Services Group

•Responsible and accountable for system design, quality assurance and implementation through all phases of the software development life cycle (SDLC) for companies spanning a wide range of industries•Project management role included: project scope identification, authoring service agreements and estimations, resource allocation, project planning, maintaining communications with clients, producing timely status reports and billing reports•Software development processes utilized during the SDLC consist of waterfall, spiral and Scrum processes.  As a Sage PSG consultant, multiple SDLC processes are utilized during any development engagement.•Customers' liaison to development team to translate customer requests into technical documentation, system and user test cases, and reporting layouts•Business requirements gathered through detailed analysis and JAD team sessions resulting in both functional and detailed design specifications•Business process reengineering and requirements gathering techniques utilized consist of UML, wireframes, control-action-response, and workflows diagrams•Data analysis and optimization for MSSQL and Oracle Sage implementations provided by thorough understanding of customer data informational needs resulting in detailed schema design, data mappings, and transformation rules for data migrations and integrations with legacy and back-office applications.•Providing on-site and remote product demonstrations and training to increase customer knowledge and efficiency•Sage Cloud Computing: Maintaining a strong role in the early testing and rollout phases of the SalesLogix Cloud computing offering; upgrading, implementing, testing and supporting internal systems in the cloud environment•Internal Sage lead engineer responsible for maintaining departmental development and quality assurance environment including VMWare, SQL, Oracle, Exchange and backup servers as well as administration of domain controllers

•	Provided internal customer desktop and server support as part of a team supporting more than 5,000 employees•	Supported desktop systems, enterprise servers and applications, networking, printing, e-mail, connectivity, remote access and hardware issues•	Provided on-site support and technology placement for local and national business partner and customer events including Sage Insights and Sage Summit•	Lead resource on project or international migration of over 2,000 systems to Office 2003 performing requirements analysis, documentation of migration plan and implementation of upgrade automation•	Provided corporate acquisition support for Active Directory and Exchange 2003 migrations and consolidation for several sites internationally from project beginning to end•	Managed and trained desktop technical staff and service desk employees•	Corporate wide Active Directory administration•	Responsible for the proper operating condition of office-wide telephony equipment and connectivity

recommendations: Mike de la Fuente
DevOps Handyman - Principle Software Engineer
January 31, 2017, Mike was senior to Bridgitte but didn’t manage directly

I worked with Bridgitte for about six months at DriveTime. During that time, I came to depend on Bridgitte as my counterpart in her role as a Scrum Master. She helped to pilot and lead my teams through an Agile transformation to Scrum. Her ability to grasp technical concepts and transform them into well defined, meaningful plain-English terminology helped to bridge the gap between the development team and product owners. Her organization skills and ability to facilitate meaningful, productive meetings helped to lead the team to many successful sprints. Bridgitte comes with a positive attitude and is a great addition to any team!
